en.header: Why is it vital to keep records of attendance?
en.klf: Keeping records of attendance not only allows you to tackle the absence problem right away, but also to base you discussion with employees on factual evidence. And discussions often lead to solutions. That's a fact!
en.tips: Creating an official employee attendance policy and getting everyone to sign it would also be a good idea...
en.choice_EJ3clrjUU: You can handle the absence problem right away, without letting it fester
en.choice_N1doxBoUL: You have factual evidence when discussing absence with the employee
en.choice_41tperj8I: Employees know you are watching them, which will deter absences
en.choice_4yCAlrj8L: You can create solutions such as flexible hours to problem schedules
